units.title: Construction of LGR5‑mNeonGreen fluorescent reporter
units.text: For the construction of a ﬂuorescent reporter, an LGR5-mNeonGreen knock-in reporter was introduced into the last exon of LGR5 via electroporation, using previously published sgRNA (Sup-
units.rationale: Describes the creation of a fluorescent knock‑in reporter in intestinal organoids.

units.title: Cloning of LGR5‑targeting sgRNAs and HDR template preparation
units.text: Two LGR5-targeting sgRNAs were cloned into SpCas9-equipped HP180 plasmids (a gift from Hui Yang lab), generating LGR5 sgRNA plasmids. HDR templates were made by replacing the CMV promoter in pBluescript II SK (+) (Addgene, #212205) with LGR5-P2AmNeonGreen sequence flanked by LGR5 homology arms using the Fast-Fusion™ Cloning Kit (GeneCopoeia).
units.rationale: Provides the molecular cloning steps needed before electroporation.

units.title: Induction of organoid differentiation by media switch
units.text: Organoids were induced to differentiate by directly changing the culture media to differentiation media. The differentiation protocols are as follows: Paneth cells. EGF (50 ng/mL), IGF-I (100 ng/mL), FGF-2 (50 ng/mL), DMH1 (2 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM), pVc (100 μg/mL) and IL-22 (2 ng/mL). Culture for 3 days.
units.rationale: Specifies the media composition and timing to generate Paneth cells.

units.title: Differentiation protocol for Goblet cells
units.text: Goblet cells. SJ000291942 (10 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM) and DAPT (10 μM) for 2 days and then replace CHIR with IWR-1 (2 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Details the small‑molecule regimen to drive goblet cell fate.

units.title: Differentiation protocol for Enteroendocrine cells
units.text: Enteroendocrine cells. DMH1 (2 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM) and CP673451 (0.5 μM) and Gefitinib (5 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Lists the factors required to obtain enteroendocrine cells.

units.title: Interference with MBD3 expression via CRISPR
units.text: To interfere with MBD3 expression, sgRNA sequences targeting MBD3 were cloned into SpCas9-equipped HP180 plasmids and electroporated into established LGR5-mNeonGreen reporter cells. Colonies from single cells were manually picked, expanded, and screened by Western blotting using an MBD3 antibody (1:200, Santa Cruz).
units.rationale: Describes a CRISPR‑based knock‑down workflow for functional studies.

units.title: Crypt isolation and embedding for organoid culture
units.text: Crypt isolation was performed as previously reported45 with modifications. Briefly, tissues were washed with DPBS to remove debris. The tissues were treated with 2.5 mM EDTA at 4 °C for 40 minutes to release crypts. The supernatant containing crypts was collected and embedded in Cultrex RGF BME (R&D Systems) droplets in 48-well plates (~50 crypts/well). After solidification, droplets were overlaid with culture medium containing 10 μM Y-27632 (TargetMol). The medium was changed every 3 days.
units.rationale: Provides a step‑by‑step method to isolate intestinal crypts and start organoid cultures.

units.title: Organoid dissociation and re‑embedding for single‑cell assays
units.text: Established organoids were dissociated into single cells with TrypLE (Gibco) and re-embedded in fresh BME at a density of approximately 8000 cells per well, in a total volume of 20 μL, within a 48-well plate.
units.rationale: Outlines how to obtain single‑cell suspensions for downstream experiments.

units.title: EdU incorporation assay for proliferation
units.text: Organoid culture medium was supplemented with 10 µM EdU (ethynyl-2’-deoxyuridine, Beyotime) and incubated for 1 hour.
units.rationale: Describes the labeling step to measure cell proliferation within organoids.
